description.narrative: To develop the capacity of, and empower, young women and men to be active citizens participate freely in the democratic process. It aims to facilitate the access of young people to political decision making structures and processes.
To develop the capacity of, and empower, young women and men to be active citizens participating freely in the democratic process.
independent political entity
Other General Services - support to civil society

- Geographical coverage of trainings and programmes conducted to promote accountable leadership of youths - Status of national and sub-national youth organizations with established governance structures

comment.narrative: - Governance training and programmes for youth limited to central division and not available to all provinces - lack of established governance structures at national and sub-national levels for youth organisations' engagement in the decision-making processes at both levels

1. Strengthen capacities of youths and youth leaders on key democratic processes. 2. Enhance institutional capacity of youth organisations at national and sub-national levels to support effective participation of young people in the democratic process.

1. Capacity building trainings/workshops completed in four divisions within Fiji for democratic transitions with mechanisms to effectively contribute to key policy frameworks of the Government and National Youth Council of Fiji. 2. NYCF and other youth organisations such as Provincial Youth Forum of Fiji Islands (PYFFI) and Youth Assemblies of Fiji Islands (YAFFI) provided trainings on institutional strengthening and strategic planning for effective engagement with democratic processes. 3. A total of 157 youths directly participated and were trained through a series of national workshops “Building Capacities of Youth to Enable Effective Democratic Participation and Social Cohesion” in four different locations as per table below targeting rural and urban youths in Fiji. The workshop surveys (with 92% participation) indicated that 100% of participants reported achieving their intended learning outcomes under the workshop of which 60% stated they had achieved their learning outcomes that included being trusted leaders, making right (or responsible) decisions, being inculcated with leadership skills and having appropriate skills to solve their issues proactively. In summary, the workshop learning objectives/outcomes were on strengthening of youth knowledge and understanding around decision-making and leadership; raised awareness on key democratic governance principles; discussed on key challenges affecting youth and identifying solutions; and developing capacities and inculcating entrepreneurship skills. 4.A national survey was conducted to gain insights on disabled people. A total of around 500 youths that participated in the National Youth and Sports Conference participated in the survey to provide inputs towards service delivery inputs relative to young people particularly with disabilities. The survey results will be used for 2016 and beyond work planning for NYCF and also for Government.

description.narrative: Effective, accountable and strengthened key government agencies that are promoting peace building, social cohesion, inclusiveness and gender equality through their provision of awareness raising and delivery of services.

title.narrative: Fiji Governance Programme - Initiation Plan Draft
Fiji Governance Programme Prodoc- Initiation Plan

description.narrative: Rights, Empowerment And Cohesion (REACH) for rural and urban Fijians Project
Justice, Law and Order - policy, planning and administration

World Bank Worldwide Governance Indicators (Voice and Accountability, Political Stability, Government Effectiveness, and Rule of Law) using percentile rank of Fiji among other countries in the world, with 0 being the lowest ranking and 100 is the highest ranking.

comment.narrative: 2014: Voice and Accountability (46.8), Political Stability (62.14), Government Effectiveness (41.35), Rule of Law (34.62. ).

1. Feasibility Study conducted and plans developed for use of mobile services. 2. Three mobile units procured and handed over to Government. 3. At least 1 coordination meeting between Govt ministries conducted in 2015.

1.Achieved. Decision made in consultation with all stakeholders for the feasibility plans for the mobile services to be undertaken through a ‘pilot’ of the ‘mobile service delivery’ in Northern Division, Fiji during the September to December.
Pilot Services Feasibility Study conducted in Northern Division to inform decision on type of mobile units to be procured. Between Sep to Dec mobile team in Northern Division conducted 17 days of awareness and service delivery to 48 villages / settlements reaching 1,127 people (Women:464; Men:507; Children:156) and delivered 729 services (Department of Women:419; Department of Social Welfare:141; Legal Aid Commission:169). Awareness and service delivery conducted in 28% of all districts in Northern Division (10 districts out of a total districts of 37) across all three provinces (Bua:5, Cakaudrove:2, Macuata:3) to remote and difficult to access areas, involving 6 days of overnight village stays, and inclusion of outreach to maritime areas. 91% of participants in the awareness sessions reported increased awareness.
On 14, 15 and 16 Oct at Women’s Expo one hour information and awareness sessions conducted by mobile team reaching 79 people (Women:78; Men:1) from across Fiji. 100% of participants reported increased awareness following the sessions. In addition ‘information booth’ established at Women’s Expo alongside Ministry and Legal Aid Commission booths. Women’s Expo received 11,673 (Women:5,636; Men:3,787; Children:2,250). On 15 Oct at Women’s Expo onstage Rural Women Talk Show conducted that was heard by all Expo stall holders (at a minimum Women:570) and broadcasted live through all six radio stations of the Fiji Broadcasting Corporation across Fiji. The Talk Show based on REACH topics of awareness raising.
On 1 and 2 Dec workshop on lessons learned from pilot mobile services conducted in Labasa with participation of 27 people (Women:17; Men:10). Workshop also including capacity building in areas of gender e

Output 1. 1. 3 mobile units procured and handed over to Government. 2. 50% of Districts in Northern, Western and Central Provinces reached each year for awareness raising by joint teams. 3. 4,000 people each year participating in awareness raising sessions conducted by joint teams undertaking mobile outreach services. 4. 2,500 people each year provided with service delivery by joint teams undertaking mobile outreach services. 5. 100 participants each year in awareness and capacity building trainings. 6. 3 Assessments, strategies, SOPs, Code of Conduct, communications products or systems developed or revised each year.
Output 2. 1. Legal Aid capacity assessment, research and technical advice undertaken.
Output 3. 1. Project staff recruited and operating effectively. 2. Inception Report completed and considered by Project Board. 3. Project Board Meetings conducted. 4. Quarterly Progress Reports completed and considered by Project Board. 5. Mid-term Evaluation conducted.

title.narrative: TC PAM Response and Recovery Programme

description.narrative: This project supports coordination efforts, needs assessments and initiation of early recovery frameworks in Vanuatu, Tuvalu and Kiribati following Tropical Cyclone PAM.

title.narrative: Vanuatu TC Pam Cash for Work/Debris Mgt Project Implementation Plan
TC PAM Response and Recovery Programme

description.narrative: Supports coordination efforts, needs assessments and initiation of early recovery frameworks, including local coordination in Vanuatu, Tuvalu and Kiribati following Tropical Cyclone PAM
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

1. Coordination support desks set up in a timely manner and operational in Suva, Vanuatu, Tuvalu and Kiribati 2. Damage/Needs assessments undertaken/supported and early recovery frameworks/plans supported 3. Communications products developed

comment.narrative: UN Resident Coordinator Support provided from Suva with minimal support from the UNICEF Led UNJPO offices in Vanuatu and Kiribati and UNDP led UNJPO in Tuvalu. UNDP support from the Fiji MCO assisted by the UNDP Programme analysts based at the UNJPO in Vanuatu and Kiribati and the UNDP CDM in Tuvalu.

1. Support to the UN Resident Coordinator/Humanitarian Coordinator office and UNDP to provide an effective response to early recovery. 2. Development of Post Disaster recovery plans/programme of action for the 3 countries 3. 1 fact sheet and two human interest stories developed

1. Suva: TC Pam desk established to coordinate recovery programme activities within the Fiji MCO Vanuatu: Immediate in country support by the UN Resident Coordinator and UNDP MCO with the establishment of an expanded UNDP presence. Logistical support provided to SURGE consultants to undertake a PDNA and provide technical advice to the Government on the recovery plan. UNDP project proposal developed and USD500K mobilised to implement a debris clearance and livelihoods resilience programme Tuvalu: UNDP presence expanded, UNDP Recovery Adviser, SURGE Debris Management Specialist, Communications Specialist fielded to assist with coordination activities, needs assessments and provide assistance to the Government on the Recovery Plan. 2. Vanuatu Cash for work and Livelihoods Recovery programme formulated and implemented, Tuvalu Recovery Plan produced 3. 3 human interest stories and 2 Fast Facts sheets published, website featured TC Pam stories
Note: Kiribati; Immediate mission fielded to undertake needs assesment but no assistance was requested by Government

No ongoing partnerships in place for income generating activities 5. Community infrastructure used for income generating activities destroyed by TC Pam in the 6 Shepherd Islands

1. 50 men and 50 women participate in CFW Port Vila and 15 men and 15 women participate in CFW in Lenakel 2.1000 cu. Meters debris cleared in Port Vila and 500 cubic meteres cleared in Lenakel. 3. 1700 alternative livelihood ventures operating 4. 3 partnerships formed 5. 6 community infrastructure rehabilitated

1. 129 people provided with emergency employment for an average of 3 weeks each, 56 female and 73 males. 42 are in the youth category; 2. 2465 cubic meters of debris cleared in Port Vila and Lenakel 3. 1735 livelihood ventures operating, 1358 women and 377 men 4. 3 partnerships formed 5. 3 community income generation buildings completed, 2 in progress .

Fiji SDG Localization
policy, planning and administration

1. Number of SDG indicators incorporated into the M&E Framework of National Development Strategies and Plans 2. Number of SDG knowledge products produced 3. Number of policies reviewed/formulated to accelerate SDG achievement 4. Number of awareness raising campaigns conducted at national and sub national levels

comment.narrative: 1. Nil SDG indicators incorporated into the M&E Framework of National Development Strategies and Plans 2. Nil SDG knowledge products produced 3. Nil policies reviewed/formulated to accelerate SDG achievement 4. Nil awareness raising campaigns conducted at national and sub national levels

1. At least 30% of SDG targets or indicators (official or tailored) are mainstreamed into the M&E framework of the NSDP; 2. At least 1 knowledge product relating to SDGs is produced in 2016 3. No target for 2016 as efforts will be focused on mainstreaming the SDGs into NSDP and Government corporate plans 4. At least 1 awareness raising activity is undertaken either at national or sub-national level (please change campaign to activity in the indicator and baseline)
